title: How to Play Spoons (Card Game)

steps.headline: Count your players.
steps.description: In the middle of the table, place however many spoons is one less than the number of players you have. For example, if you're playing with 6 people, use 5 spoons.

steps.headline: Shuffle a standard 52-card deck and deal 4 cards to each person.
steps.description: Have the dealer keep the deck next to them.

steps.headline: Have everyone take one of their cards and discard it to their left simultaneously.
steps.description: The person to the right of the dealer, however, should put one of their cards down on the table to start the discard pile, while the dealer picks up a new card. Tip: It is good strategy to exchange cards for a card that matches another card that you already have in your hand. You do not have to exchange cards with the card you are given, if you do not want to. Instead, just pass the card you received on to the player to your left.

steps.headline: Repeat this process of everyone passing to the left.
steps.description: Each round the dealer should pick up a new card and the person to their right should add to the discard pile, so as to have a continuous influx of new cards. All players continue to circulate cards. It usually goes pretty quickly, and can be tough to keep track of! This is intentional, and makes the game more fun.

steps.headline: The first person to have 4 of a kind (e.g.
steps.description: all 4 aces or all 4 nines) has to pick up a spoon. Following this, all other players need to do the same, with the slowest person left without a spoon and out of the game. Note: Often, players will try to be sneaky about grabbing a spoon, so that others will continue to play the game without realizing that a spoon has been drawn.

steps.headline: Make sure to grab a spoon as soon as you notice one missing.
steps.description: It can be easy to get caught up in trying to get your own four of a kind — try to pay attention to other people's movements as well as your hand.

steps.headline: Remove a spoon every time you remove a player from the game.
steps.description: So if the first round had 6 players and 5 spoons, the second round would consist of 5 players and 4 spoons. Continue playing until you're left with a single person, who is the winner.

tyn: Plastic or regular spoons (one fewer than the number of players; for example, 3 spoons and 4 people)
